title: How do we convert percentages of marks into grades? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on your school. If the weight of each subject wasn't explained to you by a teacher or something, go and ask. In my school I had a yearly grade (which was made by exams, homework and other school activities throughout the year) and a finals grade (final exams). The yearly grade was worth 30% of my grade in my diploma and the finals grade was worth 70%. Let's say I wanted to know my math grade in my diploma. I got 85 in my yearly grade and I got 90 in my finals. So to achieve my math diploma grade I'll multiply each by its own percentage weight and add both of them up. 85*0.3 + 90*0.7 = 88.5 That means my math diploma grade is 88.5

according to mark you to convert to it. you multiply the percentage by the desired full mark. for example if it is 70 % of 100 so it will be 70 % x 100 = 70 if it is 70% of 150 so it will be 70% x 150 = 105
In the U.S., there is absolutely no consensus on this. Every school has it’s own grading scale which is typically included as part of the transcript.
